chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Marvin A Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action. Costs have been paid in full from cash bond posted.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintain full-time employment and/or schooling. Obtain high school diploma or GED/HSED.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Must attend the Door/Kewaunee Victim Impact Panel session scheduled for 6/11/15 at the Justice Center.

timeConds.notes: STAYED as long as defendant is paying $100 per month toward OWI and OMVWOC financial obligations. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Huber release and good time granted. Credit for time served.
Costs have been paid in full from cash bond posted.

ADDRESS INFO for Marvin A Davis
Current: 6162 N. 35th Street #8, Milwaukee, WI 53209 United States  (Effective: 03-20-2015)

Defendant Marvin A Davis in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Marvin A Davis in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State amends charge to Class A Misdemeanor Operate Motor Vehicle w/o Owners Consent. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to amended charge.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of amended charge. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant has already posted $500, needs to post $2,500 to be released. No contact direct or indirect with A.G. or her residence.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.
Defendant in custody.

Defendant Marvin A Davis in court with attorney Scott L. Stebbins who appears on behalf of Atty Greg Gerbers.  Defendant Marvin A Davis in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.  Atty Stebbins explains missed court appearance in January by defendant. State requests additional cash be posted. Atty Stebbins gives argument on bond, asks court to reinstate original bond. Court increases cash bond to $3,000 total. Defendant needs to post $2,500 to be released. Same conditions apply.  Status conference scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case at 10:31 am, no appearance by defendant. Atty Gerbers has no information as to why defendant is not in court. State requests bench warant. Court orders bench warrant.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty plea. Bond continues as is.
by State
